rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Hampton is a great professor! He really knows his material and makes sure you know it too. He is a really cool guy! The TAs are extremely helpful and are willing to meet you whenever you need to. THere is no textbook, and you have to take notes, but you'll learn better through Hampton. Trust me!!!!!! Great class!!!

Anyone who can make history fun, interesting, and funny has talent. He knows exactly what he is talking about and a great professor who loves what he teaches. Extremely approachable and is always willing to meet for office hours. A good first year class for sure.
Good lectures. Interesting. Clear-cut straightforward amount of work. Plus, he is hot (for an older guy).
He's a good teacher but very hard. Knows his stuff. You probably won't get help from Hampton but the TAs are pretty good. Interesting lectures but long in the T/TH class. Good teacher though.

This professor is great.  The lectures are pretty interesting.  The midterm is a little tricky but other than that the class is enjoyable.  There are only 2 short papers and a final paper which is nothing but literally putting your notes into sentences.  Great Professor, I definitly recommend!
You don't have a book so everything comes from lecture. He calls his mid-term the Great Leveler. The final is a paper and the papers aren't too bad. Definitely recommend him

Nice teacher. Alright Class. Lectures are clear and organized but extremely boring. 1 test - hard to understand and tricky. The papers are easy. Do good on the midterm and you'll be set for the class.
Not a lot of reading, lectures semi-engaging. Pretty interesting for a history class!  This coming from a non-history major :P
Love this class!  One of the least boring lecturers I've ever had!
